title: Measuring Tie-Strength in Implicit Social Networks

author: Tina Eliassi-Rad, Department of Computer Science, Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

segmentation: Today I'm going to talk to you guys about how do we measure tie strength and implicit social networks and this is joint work with my student language, Gupta, who is now at Google.
And the problem that we are looking at is the following.

I'm given a bipartite graph of people, an events, an I would like to measure the tie strength between each pair of individual and so the assumption is that if we attend mutual events then that would imply an implicit way to social network between us so.
That's the graph that I'm going to be looking at.

The next two are frequency an, an intimacy.
